DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to describe the clinical target volume (CTV), the traditional estimate of the volume of tissue to be treated with radiotherapy using generic bony landmarks as surrogates.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues._A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.

Property.preferredDefinition: A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
